The first six digits of the MAC address are organizational unique identifiers (OUI).

https://standards-oui.ieee.org/oui/oui.txt, better than nothing.
AR function of this software is developed by AR Foundation of Unity3D, based on ARCore framework of Google.
The device coordinates displayed follow Unity3D, a left-handed, Y-Up coordinate system. \n With right x, before z and y above.

We know the location of the device through ARCore's motion tracking feature. 
 
Motion tracking is based on the Visual Inertial Odometry (VIO) technology,
 
which analyzes the image and acceleration sensor information to locate the motion.

Due to the combination of camera and acceleration analysis, AR positioning will fail in several cases: 
 
1. Tracking in a moving environment: for example, when a user uses ARCore on a moving elevator, 
 the data obtained by IMU includes not only the acceleration of the user but also the acceleration of the elevator, which will lead to tracking failure. 
 
2. Tracking dynamic environment: For example, when the user takes a picture of the fluctuating water surface, 
 the image information obtained from the camera is unstable, which will lead to the error of feature point extraction. 
 
3. Thermal drift: Both the camera and IMU are temperature sensitive devices, there may be a problem of equipment
 heating during the use of the equipment, which will affect the accuracy of the color information obtained by the camera
 and the acceleration information measured by the IMU, and then the AR object will drift.
